results.title: Mary Poppins [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Robert Stevenson, Walt Disney and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description: Based on the “Mary Poppins” books by P.L. Travers, this Walt Disney masterpiece stars Julie Andrews, Dick Van Dyke, David Tomlinson and Glynis Johns. Disney successfully melds live action sequences with stop-animation, cell animation, song and dance routines. Set in 1910, the story is that of a stultified British family being run with cold efficiency by a draconian father, who pays no mind to his two children, Jane and Michael, and their suffragette mother. The children attempt to gain their parents’ attention by unsettling a slew of nannies, until Mary Poppins arrives to save them. Poppins has magical powers that enchant the children and she eventually brings the family back together, with the aid of her friend Bert (van Dyke). Charming songs include “Chim-Chim-Cher-Ee” and “Supercalifragilisticexpialidocious.” The film was nominated for thirteen Academy Awards, winning five including Best Picture. Screen debut of Julie Andrews, who won the Oscar for Best Actress.

results.title: Heaps good: Muph n Plutonic
results.brief_description: This music video featuring animation was made by Melbourne-based video artist and animator, Anto Skene. ‘Heaps Good’ is a track from the first collaboration of acclaimed Melbourne hip hop artist MC Muphin and one of Australia’s highest profile producers, Plutonic Lab. Quality local production featuring hot local sounds.

results.title: Dissonant particles
results.brief_description:
An abstract animation based on experiments with sound. Gordon describes the work as follows “Psychoacoustic experiments have indicated that two pure sine tones are played simultaneously, they will sound most dissonant when they are around a semitone apart in pitch. In Dissonant Particles, each particle emits a sine tone. The dissonance between them acts as a repulsive force that pushes the particles apart, both in position and in pitch. There is also a long-range (“cosmological”) attractive force that prevents the particles from flying off to infinity. The particles pulsate and slowly evaporate; both of these processes affect the way they “feel” the forces acting on them. The colour of a particle indicates pitch: red for low pitches, green for intermediate, and blue for high. The camera tracks one particle, which is always shown in the centre of the screen.”
Psycho acoustics is the study of subjective experience of audio versus the scientific measurement of sound by various devices. For example, the frequency of a signal may not change but we may perceive pitch changes if the amplitude changes.
http://www.gordonmonro.com/pieces/dissparticles.html

results.title: Mary
results.brief_description: ‘Mary’ combines colour film from the early 1950s as well as modern 16mm footage. Scratched and painted upon, this experimental film links timeless images of the ocean with old footage of a young woman. The effect is both mysterious and moody creating an intangible, lingering feeling of melancholy.

results.title: Deadly Treadlies: out bush
results.brief_description:
Deadly Treadlies is a bike-rebuilding project that has operated out of Alice Springs, in local town camps and in remote Aboriginal communities since January 2003. The project was initiated in response to young people identifying bikes as a popular alternative to petrol sniffing and other substance and solvent abuse. The project has worked with over 500 young people since its inception in local town camps, schools, drop-in centres and on remote communities. In conjunction with the bike building, a series of video workshops were run and Deadly Treadlies uses footage taken by young people from Santa Teresa, Papunya and Titjikala communities.
More info at http://www.asyass.org.au

results.title: Telestreet: the Italian Media Jacking Movement
results.brief_description: “Telestreet” is a network of pirate micro TV transmitters set up by media activists across Italy. Since beginning in June 2002 there are now almost 200 stations throughout the country. This documentary contains interviews with some of those media activists.

results.title: Top shelf
results.brief_description: This stylish short animation borrows from the tradition of nastier fairytales. This creepy cautionary fable outlines what can happen to little girls who whine for toys.

results.title: Marvin's room
results.creator_credit: Jerry Zaks, Robert De Niro, Jane Rosenthal, Scott Rudin, Tribeca Productions and Miramax Films
results.brief_description: Bessie is a strong, sensitive and selfless middle-aged woman who has sacrificed her life to look after her ailing and bed-ridden father and slightly daft aunt. Her younger sister, Lee, shirked off such responsibilities, left home, married and had two children before divorcing. The marked differences between the two have meant that neither sister has been in contact for 20 years. But now Bessie has been diagnosed with leukemia, and her survival may depend on the sister she has long since erased from her life, or her two nephews whom she has never met. Cast includes: Diane Keaton, Meryl Streep, Robert De Niro, and Leonardo Di Caprio.

results.title: Once Upon a Cheese
results.creator_credit: John Richardson, Kestrel Film Productions and Hugh Stuckey
results.brief_description: A light-hearted look at the cheese industry in Australia today. Shows how cheese is made by a fully automated process. Points out that special factories have been set up to produce cheddar. Lists the different types of cheeses - all of which are now available in Australia. Touches upon the varieties to be used with wines and beer, in cooking and how to store cheese at home.
